structural_analysis.context_justification: The text begins in the Fourth Adhyāya and the First Brāhmaṇa. The smallest numbered unit is 1. Hence, the starting coordinate is 4.1.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines grantha ID, commentary author slug (rangaramanuja), and zero-padded start ID (04-01-01) for unique, sortable naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count (Single Chunk)
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided document segment (Adhyaya 4, Brāhmaṇas 1-6) fits safely within the hard cap and is grouped into a single chunk for processing efficiency.

execution_plan.description: Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad, Fourth Adhyāya, Brāhmaṇas 1 through 6.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Mantra (Kandika) is the smallest semantic unit containing the primary text and its full corresponding commentary (Pr. block).
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral found at the very end of the Mantra heading line enclosed in double vertical bars (e.g. || 1 ||).

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra/Kandika begins with bolded text and is immediately followed by its number enclosed in bolded double vertical bars.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Mantra unit is defined by the start of the next Mantra unit, OR the final commentary colophon for the Brāhmaṇa/Chapter.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Skip initial structural headings (`बृहदारण्यकोपनिषत्`, `चतुर्थोऽध्यायः`, `प्रथमब्राह्मणम्`, `बालाकिविद्या`, `गार्ग्यजातशत्रुसंवादः`) until the first Mantra text is encountered.
